SSE4042 - Teaching Social Science as a P.name: SSE4042 - Teaching Social Science as a Profession

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Admission to Secondary Education B.S Pending or Secondary Education B.S. Social Science Education Track or Lifelong Learning Track or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course will assess teaching social studies from an external perspective. Explore what being a social studies teacher means and assess the career and profession.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: POS 2041 and admission to Civics Teaching Certificate.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Pedagogical skills for teaching civics including state mandates for teaching middle school civics and preparing middle school students for the Civics End of Course Assessment.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to Secondary Education B.S Pending or Secondary Education B.S  English Language Arts Education, Social Science Education, or Lifelong Learning Tracks or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This  course  focuses  on  the  creation, teaching, and evaluation of content specific, content informed, and  effective instructional practices that  integrate  primary  sources.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

SSE4936 - Programs in Teaching Social Sc.name: SSE4936 - Programs in Teaching Social Science

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to Secondary Education B.S. Social Science Education Track or Social Science Education Lifelong Learning Track, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Special programs, strategies, and materials for middle and secondary social science majors.

SSE3112 - Elementary Social Studies for.name: SSE3112 - Elementary Social Studies for Teaching

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Admission to Elementary Education B.S. Pending or Elementary Education B.S. - Education Track or Elementary Education B.S. -  Lifelong Learning Track or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course offers a content knowledge base for elementary school social studies to address national and state standards.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Admission to Secondary Education B.S. Social Science Education Track or Social Science Education Lifelong Learning Track, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of recent developments and contemporary programs in all areas of the social sciences.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

SSE3312 - Teaching Social Science in the.name: SSE3312 - Teaching Social Science in the Elementary School

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: SSE 3112 Elementary Social Studies for Teaching  and admission to Elementary Education B.S - Education  Track or Lifelong Learning Track or C.I.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SSE 3XXX Elementary Social Studies for Teaching  and admission to Elementary Education B.S - Education  Track or Lifelong Learning Track or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Selected themes, problems, and concepts; organizing for instruction; techniques; evaluation procedures.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of secondary (grades 6-12) social science instructional programs including development of objectives, materials, processes, and assessment procedures in light of current research and practice.

College.title: College
